ucigame
Class Mouse

java.lang.Object
  ucigame.Mouse

public final class Mouse
extends java.lang.Object

The Mouse class exists to provide the programmer with a single instance, the object mouse. The Mouse class does not have a public constructor and no additional objects of this class can be made (or would make any sense). The methods in Mouse are invoked on the mouse object.

Method Detail

x

public final int x()
Returns the current x position of the mouse, relative to the upper left hand corner of the game window.

y

public final int y()
Returns the current y position of the mouse, relative to the upper left hand corner of the game window.

Xchange

public final int Xchange()
Returns the difference between the current and previous x position of the mouse, when the mouse is being dragged.

Ychange

public final int Ychange()
Returns the difference between the current and previous y position of the mouse, when the mouse is being dragged.

button

public final int button()
Returns the value of the mouse button involved when the mouse is pressed, released, moved, or dragged. The return value will be one of: mouse.NONE, mouse.LEFT, mouse.MIDDLE, mouse.RIGHT.

isAltDown

public final boolean isAltDown()
Returns true if the keyboard's Alt key is down when the mouse is pressed, released, moved, or dragged; false otherwise.

isControlDown

public final boolean isControlDown()
Returns true if the keyboard's Ctrl key is down when the mouse is pressed, released, moved, or dragged; false otherwise.

isMetaDown

public final boolean isMetaDown()
Returns true if the keyboard's Meta key is down when the mouse is pressed, released, moved, or dragged; false otherwise.

isShiftDown

public final boolean isShiftDown()
Returns true if the keyboard's Shift key is down when the mouse is pressed, released, moved, or dragged; false otherwise.

wheelClicks

public final int wheelClicks()
Returns the number of clicks as of the last time the wheel (a special kind of middle mouse button) was rotated. A negative value means the mouse wheel was rotated up/away from the user, and a positive value means the mouse wheel was rotated down/towards the user. The value is usually -1 or 1.

sprite

public final Sprite sprite()
Returns the topmost Sprite object under the current mouse position. The return value will be null if the mouse position is not over a sprite.

setCursor

public void setCursor(int cursorType)
Changes the cursor to one of the standard system cursors. Legal values for cursorType are: mouse.CROSSHAIR, mouse.DEFAULT, mouse.HAND, mouse.MOVE, mouse.TEXT, mouse.WAIT, mouse.N_RESIZE, mouse.NE_RESIZE, mouse.E_RESIZE, mouse.SE_RESIZE, mouse.S_RESIZE, mouse.SW_RESIZE, mouse.W_RESIZE, mouse.NW_RESIZE.

setCursor

public void setCursor(Image image,
                      int xPos,
                      int yPos)
Changes the cursor to the specified Image. The size of the cursor is determined by the operating system, and the image will be scaled if necessary. In practice 32 by 32 works well. The xPos and yPos values indicate the position of the cursor's "hot spot," relative to the upper left hand corner of the image.
